alert.note: Alert for Citrus (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 28 at 9:51AM EDT until further notice by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tampa Bay Ruskin FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... Withlacoochee At SR 200 Holder affecting Citrus County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Florida... Hillsborough River At Morris Bridge affecting Hillsborough County. .Heavy rainfall expected due to Hurricane Ian will lead to flooding across many area rivers. For the Withlacoochee...including US 301 Trilby, Croom, SR 200 Holder, US 41 Dunnellon...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Hillsborough...including Morris Bridge, Temple Terrace, Hillsborough River State Park...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Withlacoochee At SR 200 Holder. * WHEN...From Friday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Arrowhead subdivision floods with water in homes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday morning and continue rising to 9.7 feet Saturday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.9 feet on 08/25/2003. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Mon Withlacoochee SR 200 Holde 8.0 5.0 Wed 8 am 5.7 8.1 9.7 10.4 10.7 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM EDT.
